chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jay Allen Potack

records.addlTxt:
10:03 AM Defendant Jay Allen Potack in court.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Jay Allen Potack.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Attny Thomas-Schmidt acknowledges information, waives reading. enters not guilty on behalf of the DEF. Court enters NG Plea to all counts. Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial. State does not object to setting a status conference. All parties agree, Court schedules. Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for January 24, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on January 24, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

11:31 AM Defendant Jay Allen Potack in court.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt appeared by video for Jay Allen Potack.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.    Attny Thomas-Schmidt indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.  State calls witness, City of Hayward Officer Dillon Saraniecki , sworn in by Deputy Clerk Torstenson.   State begins examination.   11:35 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination.   11:38 AM State tenders witness.  11:39 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Thomas-Schmidt.   11:40 AM  State makes Objection, Relevance - Court sustained.  Attny Thomas-Schmidt no further questions.  State no re-direct.  11:40 AM  Witness excused.  No further witness be either party.  State request for bind over.  Attny Thomas-Schmidt no argument against probable cause and ruling on objection.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  
Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Arraignment scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Do not drive without a valid driver license.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
9:50 AM Defendant Jay Allen Potack in court.  Attorney Alysja Otten (special appearance) appears in court.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.  Court reviews criminal complaint with DEF.   Through Attorney DEF waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  State makes bond recommendation.  Attny Otten no objection. Court sets bond.
